organization.fullName: University of Michigan Rogel Cancer Center

identificationModule.briefTitle: Breast Cancer Resiliency Through Exercise Program (B-REP)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Breast Cancer Resiliency Through Exercise Program (B-REP): Pilot Study

leadSponsor.name: University of Michigan Rogel Cancer Center

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The study will use a cross-sectional study design with a follow-up 2-arm randomized controlled trial with that has assessments at baseline, post-intervention (i.e., Week 12), and 3-months post-intervention (i.e., Week 24). The 2 arms are the 12-week intervention and a health education control among 60 Black breast cancer survivors.

armGroups.label: Intervention (Supervised exercise)
armGroups.description: The individualized resistance exercise program is based on participants' baseline 1-repetition maximum muscular strength assessment (i.e., the maximum lifted for 1 repetition) and is aligned with current cancer-specific exercise recommendations. The resistance exercise program will follow the FITT principle (frequency, intensity, time, and type). Sessions will be 35-45 minutes in duration.

armGroups.label: Control
armGroups.description: Participants randomized to health education control condition will receive the American Cancer Society Physical Activity and the Person with Cancer summary for patients and American College of Sports Medicine Exercise is Medicine Effects of Exercise on Health-Related Outcomes in Those with Cancer infographic

interventions.name: Control Arm
interventions.description: American Cancer Society Physical Activity and the Person with Cancer summary for patients will be provided

primaryOutcomes.description: Percent of patients that complete the intervention
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 24 weeks after start of intervention

primaryOutcomes.description: Percent of patients that complete the exercise sessions

Upon completion of the trial, a random sample of 10 recorded sessions will be analyzed for fidelity. Research staff who did not conduct the intervention will use a "fidelity checklist" of specific exercises and intervention characteristics (e.g., allowing time for questions, cueing for proper posture and form, etc.) required for each exercise session..
14-item scale measuring ease of use, convenience, engagement, enjoyment, and privacy elements of the intervention.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 24 weeks after start of intervention

primaryOutcomes.description: 36-item scale assessing views, attitude, and experiences in exercise87
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 24 weeks after start of intervention

primaryOutcomes.description: Single item, "Now that you've completed this part of the study, how burdensome or difficult did you find the experience. Select the response that best represents your experience." (1= Very burdensome to 5= Not too burdensome.)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 24 weeks after start of intervention

primaryOutcomes.description: 15-item scale assessing physical, social, and self-evaluative outcomes of exercise
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to 24 weeks after start of intervention

overallOfficials.name: Angela Fong, PhD
overallOfficials.affiliation: University of Michigan Rogel Cancer Center
